author: Dustyn

review: I have been using a mac mini hooked up to my television for many years. Mainly, I use Hulu Plus, NetFlix, Amazon Prime, and Plex. I have a bluetooth mouse pad and keyboard which makes it pretty easy, but I still have to lean over to the coffee table to navigate until I find what I want to watch.With the Amazon Fire TV, I can navigate through all those apps much faster than I could with my mac mini. I have watched movies and shows with Plex, Hulu, Netflix, Amazon Prime, and even rented a couple of movies off Amazon and the quality has been great. I haven't had a single issue streaming. I was concerned with this because when Amazon Prime first started, I had a lot of buffering issues, but they have definitely gotten that worked out.With Plex, since my movies are hosted on my Mac Mini and streamed, I had to remember to set my mac mini to not sleep, otherwise you'll go into Plex and none of your movies will be listed, no matter how many times you refresh. So, I guess my mac mini will use a little more power now, I can deal with that.The voice feature has worked great for me, but it only works with Amazon Prime... If it would tie into Plex, NetFlix, etc.., it would be much more useable. Also, if you need to search for something by typing in the name, you're not going to enjoy it since you have to curser to the alphabet pasted on the screen. I tend to just browse, so I can deal with it...  I thought there would be a remote app that you can install on a smartphone, but I haven't seen anything on my few searches.I have not played any of the games, so I can't provide feedback on that.Overall, I'm very happy and I plan on buying a second for another room in the house. I wish the layout was more customizable and wish the remote had a qwerty keyboard (or there was an amazon fire tv remote app), but having a couple fire tablets, I'm used to it.

author: Lawrence J Earl

review: When I first saw the Amazon Fire TV advertised, I was incredibly excited. I had been looking for a solution to my Sonos sound bar/ projector home theater system. The Fire TV comes with an optical audio out which plugs directly into the Sonos bar and what I was most excited about was the USB drive.....Turns out the USB drive doesn't actually work. So I cant plug it into the box and stream anything off of it, its essentially a useless port. Had I known that I probably would've stuck with the WD TV box that I was using despite its horrible operating system.Im still holding out hope that amazon will push an update to the box that allows the USB drive to be used like the Roku 3, I personally recommend the Roku 3 to anyone who is considering buying this box, keep in mind that the Roku 3 doesn't have an optical audio out port.
